page.title: 07CALLIPERS HALL
page.content: The first house on this site was built about 180 years ago. The original building was 3 storeys high but fire destroyed the top floor which was never replaced. Last year an extension was added which took 8 months to build. One part of the house is Victorian and the rest Georgian. The roof of the Victorian part is pitched and tiled, the rest of the roof is flat. The house has 21 rooms and bells for Room Service are still in working order. There are 17 acres of land around the house, these include an orchard, a 2 acre paddock where the owners ponies are kept and a very large garden. There is an area of mature mixed woodland close to the house and long drives provide access to the lanes.Outhouses include 6 stables, a garage, a coach house and a barn.
